title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Monday 3 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: pedestrian critically ill after car crash .
leicester stabbing victim in stable condition .
video appeal after swadlincote bank robbery .
broadmarsh replacement car parks set to open .
rise in overweight children in leicestershire .
tennis : boulter prepares for wimbledon debut .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live will return at 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: weather : cloudy weather to remain
text: the pollen count across the east midlands will remain high for the rest of today and tomorrow .
this afternooon will stay cloudy with some bright and sunny spells .
this evening will be dry and mild with clear spells , temperatures reaching lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
tomorrow will be cloudy with scattered showers and some bright spells .
temperatures will reach highs of 21c ( 70f ) , it will steadily increase over the next few days with the chance of some warm sunshine by midweek .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: murphy rejoins burton from leeds
text: murphy rejoins burton from leeds

documents.title: leeds midfielder back with brewers
text: burton albion have re-signed midfielder luke murphy on a season-long loan from fellow championship side leeds united .
the 27-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at the pirelli stadium and brewers boss nigel clough said he was `` delighted '' to welcome him back .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man 'punched to ground ' in street attack
text: a man 's been punched to the ground in an attack in burton .
the victim was hit twice on the side of the head in the assault on 26 june .
officers say that caused him to fall to the ground on melbourne avenue and he was then hit two more times on the back of his head .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: high number of dog attacks on posties in ng postcode
text: nottinghamshire had one of the highest rates of dog attacks on postal workers in the past year , new figures have revealed .
last year 43 posties were attacked by dogs while they were on their rounds in the ng postcode area .
karl russell , who has been a postman in nottingham for 23 years , said he routinely took dog biscuits with him after his first attack .

he said : `` if the door is left open and if you have to walk down the pathway towards it , you do n't know if when you get to the door , if a dog is going to come scooting out and go for you - that is one of the worst ones . ''
the ng postcode area had the tenth highest number of attacks on posties in the last year .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thousands arrive at wollaton hall for dinosaur exhibition
text: wollaton hall attracted 7,338 visitors over the weekend to its dinosaurs of china exhibition .
the exhibition , which will stay on until 29 october , will tell the story of how dinosaurs evolved into birds .
the skeletons , which arrived after a 50-day sail from china , took two weeks for the installation process .

rebecca wilson , programmes co-ordinator for nottingham city museums & galleries , said : `` it was even better than we had hoped and all of the visitors were so eager and enthusiastic to see the exhibition .
`` we 've had extremely positive feedback from visitors about the exhibition and the activities in the dino explorer zone .
`` many visitors were just amazed that we have something like this in nottingham . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pedestrian critically ill after ripley crash
text: a 20-year-old man is in a critical condition after being hit by a car in ripley .
police said the pedestrian was seriously injured when a renault clio crashed into him near the junction of nottingham road and brickyard lane at about 20:30 on wednesday .
they 're now asking anyone with dashcam footage of the crash to get in touch .
details of the crash have only just been released by derbyshire police .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes sign non-league striker gordon
text: foxes sign non-league striker gordon

documents.title: your questions : why does oakham 's stocks have five holes ?
text: shoppers in the centre of a busy rutland town everyday pass a set of medieval stocks , once used to punish locals who stepped out of line .
but it 's a little unusual as it appears to have an extra hole .
derek cullen asked us : `` why have the stocks in oakham got five holes instead of four ? ''
dr sarah richardson at the university of warwick helped us out with an answer and we returned to the town to found out what the people thought of its possibly grisly past
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prisoners to hold their own art exhibition
text: artwork created by prisoners from leicester will be showcased at an exhibition .
the hear me out exhibition will feature paintings , drawings , digital art and 3d models .
it has been produced by prisoners from leicester prison and glen parva prison as part of art sessions to boost prisoners ' wellbeing .

weekly workshops were held for prisoners , particularly those with mental ill health combined with alcohol and substance misuse , giving them the chance to express themselves and learn creative skills .
it will be on display at soft touch arts in leicester from saturday 8 july until saturday 29 july .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ashley 'vomited in fireplace at meeting '
text: ashley 'vomited in fireplace at meeting '

documents.title: one-day cup arrives back in nottingham
text: now here 's a sight to behold - nottinghamshire 's triumphant cricketers have brought the one-day cup back to trent bridge .
the outlaws beat surrey to win the final on saturday , with alex hales 's record-breaking 187 not out proving the icing on the cake .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wisdom : 'it 's good to be back '
text: new derby county signing andre wisdom has been reflecting on his loan spell at the club three years ago .
he told the club 's official site : it 's good to be back - i can remember my time here before like it was yesterday .
i loved it at derby so it is good to sign .
it helps that i have been here before so i am familiar with some of the players and staff , as well how the club works , so it made the decision easy .
i feel that i played the best season of my professional career here before .
even after i left derby and went elsewhere , i do n't think i was playing the kind of football that i was during that loan spell .
`` i hope i can replicate what i did before this time around . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university pioneers new mental health phone app
text: leicester 's de montfort university has become the first in the country to adopt a new smartphone app that helps students suffering from a range of mental health conditions .
brain in hand uses prompts to remind users where they need to be throughout the day and features a red button they can use to alert support staff if they need help urgently .
holly mckenna smith , who has autism and is among 40 students at the university using the app , described it as `` a godsend '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : men who robbed bank caught on camera
text: watch : men who robbed bank caught on camera

documents.title: burst water main causing traffic delays in anstey
text: something to be aware of if you 're heading to anstey
# anstey travel warning - @ twitterid repairing burst water main at the nook .
temporary lights on all approaches .
expect congestion into tomorrow
20 mins to get from a46 to the old b & b gon na mess up a46 & even inner ring road at peak
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police seek answers on mystery sword
text: any sword experts out there ?
police in south leicester are keen to know more about this sword which was recently handed in to them .
just had this handed in .
does anyone know the history of this sword .
as will be disposed of would be shame if museum waned it .
vince
wonder if @ twitterid might know a bit about this
looks ornamental rather than practical .
@ twitterid what do you think
late 19th/early 20th century decorative or costume piece we think .
antique but not a functional weapon as hilt looks all-in-one cast .
maybe @ twitterid may know someone who knows ?
no idea , but has castle on one side and lion on other , which internet suggests may be spanish ceremonial sword ( no similar found )
@ twitterid might want it , looks rather special
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: massive reward for bank robbery information
text: a £ 25,000 reward is on offer for anyone who can identify the two men in this cctv footage .
police want to speak to them following a robbery at hsbc bank in swadlincote back in december .
a `` substantial '' amount of cash was stolen by two men who used a sledgehammer and concrete block to break in to the high street building .
the cash has been offered for information leading to a conviction .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby sign liverpool defender wisdom
text: derby sign liverpool defender wisdom

documents.title: wisdom completes rams move
text: derby county have completed the signing of liverpool defender andre wisdom on a four-year deal .
the 24-year-old , who had a successful loan with the club during the 2013/14 season , joins for an undisclosed fee .
wisdom is gary rowett 's second summer recruit following the purchase of centre-back curtis davies from hull city .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby mp handed role in shadow cabinet
text: derby north mp chris williamson has been made a shadow home affairs minister by labour leader jeremy corbyn .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: 'unique ' sculpture stolen from museum and art gallery
text: a `` unique '' silver mayfly has been stolen from derby museum and art gallery , derbyshire police have said .
the sculpture , which was taken on 5 june , is a 10cm long solid silver cast of a mayfly .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flanker mccaffrey leaves leicester
text: flanker mccaffrey leaves leicester

documents.title: ex-wolves chief executive joins burton
text: ex-wolves chief executive joins burton

documents.title: ex-wolves chief moxey joins brewers board
text: former wolves chief executive jez moxey has joined burton albion as a non-executive director .
moxey has also held senior roles at partick thistle , rangers and stoke city , where he oversaw the club 's move to the britannia stadium in 1997 .
burton albion chairman ben robinson said : i 'm delighted to welcome jez onto the board .
`` he lives in the midlands and brings with him a wealth of experience at a number of high-profile football clubs . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: blake and bella : police still investigating missing lamb
text: police hunting for a lamb who went missing in may with her canine best friend have said it remains `` an ongoing investigation '' .
bella was five weeks old when she disappeared from a garden in perlethorpe , notts with one-year-old border collie blake .
blake returned later that month but bella remains missing - despite a major social media campaign to find her .
a spokesman for nottinghamshire police said there had been no further developments over the past few weeks .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: supermarket crash leaves woman with brain damage
text: a motorist reversed into a married couple , causing the wife to fall and suffer brain damage , while trying to collect a £ 1 parking refund .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: burton v blues to be shown live
text: burton albion 's home game against birmingham city has been brought forward by a day after being selected for live television coverage .
the game will kick off at 19:45 on friday 18 august .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tram delays in nottingham
text: there are no trams between wilkinson street and the forest in nottingham at the moment and other services are running with increased waiting times .
net nottingham tram
nettram
service on all other areas of the system is running with increased wait times .
we have shuttle buses on their way to get passengers 2/3
service on all other areas of the system is running with increased wait times .
we have shuttle buses on their way to get passengers 2/3
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police hunt on-the-run double rapist
text: leicestershire police have renewed their appeal for help in tracking down a convicted double rapist who has breached his prison licence .
sean perry , 46 , who also uses the surnames cawthray and goldthorpe , was last seen at his probation-approved address in leicester on 19 june .
police have warned members of the public not to approach him .
author: Christian Hill
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: man charged with newark pub assault
text: a 47-year-old man from lincoln has been charged with assault after an incident at a pub in newark , nottinghamshire police said .
the victim was with his wife and three children on saturday 17 june when he had gone to the bar where he was allegedly pushed and head butted at the muskham ferry pub .
the man is due to appear before nottingham magistrates ' court on monday 17 july .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands airport issues travel warning
text: something to bear in mind if you 're jetting off this week
a reminder that there are on-going road-works around the airport , please allow extra time to get to us -
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : summer in derbyshire
text: some lovely weather this weekend - here 's how the peak district looked .
thanks to fanfoz for the photo .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: drink-drive pensioner crashed into policeman 's car
text: a pensioner who drank three glasses of wine plus some whisky at lunchtime before reversing into an off-duty police officer 's car has been banned from the roads for four years .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: man stabbed in leicester city centre
text: a man is recovering in hospital after he was found was stabbed in leicester city centre yesterday morning , leicestershire police said .
officers found the 21-year-old man injured at about 03:45 outside brighthouse in belgrave gate .
police said he is in a stable condition .
leicestershire police said inquiries are in the early stages .
four men were arrested at the scene for an unrelated public order offence .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video appeal after swadlincote bank robbery
text: cctv footage has been released in a reappeal for information about a bank robbery in swadlincote .
police said two men used a sledgehammer and a concrete block to break into hsbc in high street before stealing a `` substantial '' amount of cash .
the bank has offered a £ 25,000 reward for information leading to a conviction over the robbery , which happened in december .
warning : third party video content may contain adverts .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : farmer saves cows from slaughterhouse
text: an ashbourne farmer who decided to send his cows to a sanctuary rather than the slaughterhouse has been explaining his decision .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicestershire 's boulter prepares to make wimbledon debut
text: wimbledon gets under way today with leicestershire 's katie boulter set to make her first appearance at the tournament tomorrow .
the 20-year-old was awarded a wild card for the competition and will face world number 59 christina mchale .
she said : `` i 'm definitely going to relish the opportunity to have a go at her .
it 's a chance to test my skills and see how well i can do .
`` obviously i 'm going to be a little nervous and excited .
there 's going to be such a mix . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: broadmarsh replacment car parks to open soon
text: work on two temporary car parks in nottingham city centre is almost finished .
they will replace broadmarsh car park which will close on 10 july ahead of its demolition .
one is being created off canal street below the tram bridge and a second near cliff road .
bus stops will be located at various locations around the city centre while the bus station is rebuilt .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyberman heads to the shops
text: if you spotted a cyberman at derby 's wyvern retail park this morning then do n't worry - the city is n't under attack .
the suit actually belongs to swadlincote 's stephen griffiths and he wore it out and about for this morning 's breakfast show on bbc radio derby .
the doctor who fan , who works as a dj and paranormal investigator , joined millions in watching the show 's finale at the weekend .
he told us he also owns his own dalek .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester 's central fire station could close
text: concerns are growing that central fire station in leicester could face closure .

leicestershire 's chief fire officer steve lunn has confirmed the service is looking at initial proposals for sharing a city centre hub with the police at their mansfield house building near the haymarket bus station - but insists it 's only an idea .
community campaigner mags lewis described the potential consequences of closing the fire station on lancaster road as `` frightening '' .
author: Christian Hill
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: concerns over potential new housing estate
text: more than 500 objections have been raised by west bridgford residents over plans to build 600 homes .
work is already underway on 900 homes in sharpill woods but developers now want to make the top end of musters road into a through route and build more homes .
plans have been submitted by john a wells and bovis homes , who says only one third of the estimated traffic would use the road .
guy roberts from the sharphill action group said : `` if they build 1,500 homes here and each has perhaps six journeys a day , that is 9,000 car journeys a day off this site .

`` most of the amenities are towards trent bridge and nottingham that way , so while a proportion of people will drive out the ring road an awful lot of traffic will be heading down west bridgford , which is why we are anxious about musters road being opened . ''
simon robinson , leader of rushcliffe borough council , said it was 'imperative ' that residents put their concerns forward .
he said : `` we have got to build over 13,000 houses across the borough , it is very difficult and we have six major sites to do that and sharpill hill is one of them . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: week in the sun for rams squad
text: derby county 's players have arrived at their summer training camp in tenerife .
the squad will stay on the island for a week before returning to their pre-season friendly campaign .
deals bringing in andre wisdom ( from liverpool and taking tom ince to huddersfield town are yet to be finalised .
author: Ed Dawes
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: fine for organiser of 'disgusting ' winter wonderland event
text: the organiser of a family christmas event that was branded `` disgusting '' by visitors has been fined for illegally advertising it .
shaun hogg was behind the bakewell winter wonderland and christmas market , which drew sharp criticism on social media last year for its muddy conditions and lack of festive feel .
amber valley borough council said mr hogg was fined £ 2,000 plus costs after admitting putting up signs for the event in duffield and quarndon in october .

chris short , the authority 's cabinet member for the environment , said : casually erecting advertising signs on grass verges , street furniture and traffic roundabouts is not only unsightly and has a detrimental effect on the community , but it is a dangerous distraction to motorists . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: busy road in hucknall closed because of unsafe building
text: a main road in and out of hucknall remains closed today .
annesley road was shut throughout the weekend because of an unsafe building between spring street and baker street .
the road is expected to remain closed for the day .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: vandals could force closure of markeaton rope adventure course
text: the operators of a rope adventure course at markeaton park in derby say repeated vandalism could force them to close it permanently .
the challenge academy adventure hub is currently closed after vandals caused up to £ 20,000 of damage in the most recent attack .
the company said it had experienced more problems with vandalism at its derby site than anywhere else in the country .
greg brookes-clayton , from challenge academy , said : `` it 's demotivating for myself and the team when time after time we come in in the morning to find more damage . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rise in number of overweight children in leicestershire
text: the number of children classed as obese or overweight is on the rise in leicestershire .
the figure for 10 and 11-year-olds in the year to april 2016 was 31.5 % - up from 29.9 % in the previous year .
for reception class children , the figure has risen from 20.2 % to 21.6 % in the same period .
paula mckee , a dietician who works on a weight management programme for children in charnwood said many parents were surprised to find their children were classed as overweight .
she said : `` 75 % of parents do n't realise their child is overweight .
if you think one-in-three is overweight at year six and one-in-five at reception , people look round the playground and think their child is exactly the same as other children in the playground .
`` sometimes it can be a great shock for them and some can get quite upset about it . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning .
hope everyone had a lovely weekend .
gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
